name: Turkey
fact: Controls the Bosporus and Dardanelles straits, the only maritime passage between the Black Sea and the Mediterranean.

name: Bulgaria
fact: Home to ancient Thracian civilizations and features coastal cities like Varna and Burgas on the Black Sea.

name: Romania
fact: Features the major port city of Constanța, founded as the ancient Greek colony of Tomis.

name: Ukraine
fact: Possesses a long Black Sea coastline including the major port city of Odesa, founded in 1794.

name: Russia
fact: Has a significant coastline on the northeast Black Sea, including resort cities like Sochi and the major port of Novorossiysk.

name: Georgia
fact: Located on the eastern coast, its history in the region includes the ancient kingdom of Colchis, known from Greek mythology.

name: Istanbul
fact: Historically known as Constantinople, it served as the capital of the Byzantine and Ottoman Empires, controlling access to the Black Sea.

name: Odesa
fact: A major Ukrainian port city established by Catherine the Great, famous for its Potemkin Stairs.

name: Crimean Peninsula
fact: A peninsula historically controlled by Greeks, Romans, Byzantines, Genoese, Tatars, and Ottomans before being annexed by Russia in 1783.

name: Chersonesus
fact: An ancient Greek colony founded near modern Sevastopol (Crimea) in the 6th century BC, later a key Byzantine outpost.
